game

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    The Map represents the 2D array on which the game is actually played. It holds each Tile, as well as performs pathfinding.
    Author:
    Team Rosetta

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(int n,
   long seed)
        Parameters:
        n - - This is the "size" of the map generated using the diamond-square algorithm. Specifically, diamond-square is used to fractally (or more iteratively) generate a map of size 2^n+1 by 2^n+1.
        seed - - A long used to seed the random number generator, should that be desired.

      • Map

        public Map(int n)
        Parameters:
        n - - The size of the map.

      • findNearest

        public Building findNearest(Tile start,
                   BuildingEnum type)
        This method, as per the name, finds the nearest Building of the appropriate type.
        Parameters:
        start - - the Tile for the starting location. We search for the nearest Building to this Tile.
        type - - the type of Building to be found.
        Returns:
        Building - the Building found.
